flags.title: Feature Flags
flags.subtitle: Manage and control your application features
flags.noFlagsDesc: Create your first feature flag to start controlling features across your environments.
flags.name: Name
flags.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this flag?
flags.infoDesc: Feature flags allow you to control which features are enabled in your application without deploying new code. Toggle flags on or off per environment to gradually roll out new features, perform A/B testing, or quickly disable problematic features.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Manage your feature flag projects
projects.noProjectsDesc: Create your first project to start managing feature flags. Each project comes with 3 default environments.
projects.createDesc: Add a new project to organize your feature flags
projects.keyHint: Auto-generated from name, but you can customize it
projects.autoGenerated: Auto-generated from name, but you can customize it
projects.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this project? This will delete all flags and environments associated with it. This action cannot be undone.
projects.infoDesc: Projects help you organize feature flags across different applications or teams. Each project automatically gets 3 environments (Development, Test, Production) when created. You can manage additional environments from the Environments page.

environments.title: Environments
environments.subtitle: Manage deployment environments for your feature flags
environments.noEnvironmentsDesc: Create your first environment to start managing feature flags across different deployment stages.
environments.createDesc: Add a new environment to manage feature flag states
environments.editDesc: Update the name or key of this environment
environments.keyHint: Auto-generated from name, but you can customize it
environments.name: Name
environments.infoDesc: Environments allow you to manage feature flags across different deployment stages. Each environment can have different flag states, enabling you to test features before releasing them to production. Enter any name you want - common examples include Development, Testing, Staging, and Production.
environments.deleteWarning: This will permanently delete this environment and all associated flag states. This action cannot be undone.
environments.deleteProtected: This is a default environment and cannot be deleted. Default environments (Development, Test, Production) are protected.

segments.title: User Segments
segments.subtitle: Target specific user groups with feature flags
segments.comingSoonDesc: Create and manage user segments to target specific groups with your feature flags. Define segments based on user attributes, behavior, or custom rules.
segments.underDevelopment: This feature is currently under development.

auditLog.title: Audit Log
auditLog.subtitle: Track all changes and activities
auditLog.comingSoonDesc: View a comprehensive history of all changes made to your feature flags, environments, and projects. Track who made changes and when.
auditLog.underDevelopment: This feature is currently under development.
auditLog.timeline: Complete activity timeline for all flag changes
auditLog.filtering: Filter by user, environment, or action type
auditLog.rollback: Rollback capabilities based on audit history

auth.sessionExpired: Your session has expired. Signing you out...

login.title: Login
login.subtitle: Enter your email and password to access your account

signup.title: Create an account
signup.subtitle: Get started with your free developer account today
signup.passwordLengthError: Password must be at least 8 characters

forgotPassword.title: Forgot Password
forgotPassword.subtitle: Enter your email address and we'll send you a link to reset your password.

targeting.title: Individual User Targeting
targeting.noUsers: No users specifically targeted for this flag.

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Manage your account and project settings
settings.apiKeysDesc: SDK keys are generated per project
settings.apiKeysInfo: API key management is available in the project settings. Navigate to your project to view and manage SDK keys for each environment.
settings.emailNotificationsDesc: Receive email updates about flag changes
settings.flagChangeAlertsDesc: Get notified when flags are toggled in production
settings.weeklyReportsDesc: Receive weekly summary of flag usage
settings.notificationsComingSoon: Notification preferences will be available once the notification system is implemented.
settings.securityInfo: Password change functionality will be available in a future update. For now, please contact support to reset your password.
